snippet: A book on the fern fever that hit Britain in the 1870s, Fry glass for sale, and a sword that fetches $81,000.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; Sarah Whittingham's book Fern Fever: The Story of Pteridomania tells about the late-19th-century craze for ferns; hundreds of pieces of glassware made by Henry C Fry, now part of the estate of John A and Dorothy Jordan, will be auctioned at Jeffrey S Evans & Associates in Mount Crawford, Va; Metropolitan Museum of Art buys a New York militiaman’s 1850 parade sword for $81,000 at Capo Auction.
lead_paragraph: A book on the fern fever that hit Britain in the 1870s, Fry glass for sale, and a sword that fetches $81,000.

headline.seo: Fern History, Fry Glass and a Militiaman’s Sword
headline.main: 19th-Century Fern Fever, in England and Beyond
headline.print_headline: 19th-Century Fern Fever, In England and Beyond
